import FolderTreeExpandCollapse from './FolderTreeExpandCollapse?dev-site-example';

# Expand/Collapse All

### Description

The following example demonstrates expand/collapse all functionality.
Expand/collapse all functionality is accessible via the toolbar buttons.

### Required Properties

Expanded/collapsed state is controlled by the consuming component.
The following FolderTree props are required for expand/collapse all:
* **[onExpandAll](../about#foldertree-props-table)**: This callback is called when interacting with the Expand All button.
* **[onCollapseAll](../about#foldertree-props-table)**: This callback is called when interacting with the Collapse All button.

Only FolderTreeItems that have `subfolderItems` with 1 or more items can be expanded/collapsed,
and will display a folder icon.

```js
// Initialize folders to be collapsed
const [expandedItems, setExpandedItems] = React.useState({
  "row-item-1": false,
  "row-item-2": false
});

const handleExpandAll = () => {
  const newExpandedItems = {
    ...expandedItems,
  };
  // Set all folder items in the tree to expanded
  Object.keys(newExpandedItems).forEach(v => { newExpandedItems[v] = true; });

  setExpandedItems(newExpandedItems);
};

const handleCollapseAll = () => {
  const newExpandedItems = {
    ...expandedItems,
  };
  // Set all folder items in the tree to collapsed
  Object.keys(newExpandedItems).forEach(v => { newExpandedItems[v] = false; });

  setExpandedItems(newExpandedItems);
};

<FolderTree
  title={data.title}
  onExpandAll={handleExpandAll}
  onCollapseAll={handleCollapseAll}
>
  // FolderTree children can be any number of FolderTree.Items
</FolderTree>
```

<FolderTreeExpandCollapse />
